title: Dani Alves sexual assault conviction overturned
content: The top court in Spain's Catalonia region said Friday it had overturned the conviction of Brazilian soccer player Dani Alves for sexual assault.

title: Duke back in Elite 8 behind Flagg's 30-point clinic
content: Duke's Cooper Flagg put on a skills clinic against Arizona, finishing with 30 points, 6 rebounds, 7 assists and 3 blocks Thursday night in a 100-93 win. The Blue Devils are in the Elite Eight for the second straight season.

title: 'Special moment': Giddey's 47-footer stuns Lakers
content: Josh Giddey heaved a buzzer-beating 47-foot 3-pointer from half court to cap perhaps the wildest finish in the NBA this season, giving the Chicago Bulls a 119-117 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers on Thursday night.

title: 'Whatever it takes': TTU storms back in OT thriller
content: Darrion Williams scored the tiebreaking basket with 7.3 seconds left in overtime as Texas Tech rallied from a 16-point deficit to beat Arkansas 85-83 and earn a spot in the Elite Eight.

title: Ex-Vols coach Pruitt sues NCAA, seeking $100M
content: Former Tennessee football coach Jeremy Pruitt has filed a lawsuit against the NCAA seeking $100 million and claims it conspired with the university to make him a "sacrificial lamb."

title: Ovi, Caps honor Wild's Fleury with handshakes
content: Alex Ovechkin made sure all Capitals players shook hands postgame with retiring Wild goalie Marc-Andre Fleury after Thursday's game.

title: Arenado soaks in emotional post-HR curtain call
content: Nolan Arenado's eighth-inning homer Thursday had plenty of extra meaning after he spent much of the offseason on the trading block, and Cardinals fans knew it, bringing him out for a curtain call.

title: Terps' Willard unsure of future after tourney exit
content: Maryland men's basketball coach Kevin Willard was noncommittal about his future with the Terrapins after they were eliminated by Florida on Thursday in the Sweet 16.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Ranking the 25 best players in the women's Sweet 16: From Betts and Bueckers to Strong and Van Lith﻿
content: Does Paige Bueckers, Lauren Betts or Hannah Hidalgo takes over the top spot in our Sweet 16 player rankings?

title: 3-pointer problem? Why the NBA has no qualms with it -- yet
content: This season has seen a historic number of 3-point attempts. But does the league really need to rein in the 3s?

title: Inside Elic Ayomanor's viral night and journey from Canada to the NFL draft
content: From Medicine Hat, Alberta, the Stanford receiver came along way to a record night against Travis Hunter and his NFL future.

title: Olympic champ Chloe Kim has a new outlook, new tricks -- and the old dominance
content: After struggling with depression, the snowboarder has found her joy again as she looks to qualify for the 2026 Olympics Saturday at Worlds.

title: Six theories on why penalties (and power plays) are dramatically down this NHL season
content: Are players playing cleaner? Are referees swallowing their whistles? Players, execs, and analysts offer ideas.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Robinson's rise has Fulham dreaming of Europe and the U.S. a World Cup
content: In a breakout season, Fulham's Antonee Robinson has emerged as one of the best left backs in the world, and he's dreaming of big things with the U.S.

title: Braden Smith's long road to Big Ten basketball, the Purdue record books and another Sweet 16
content: It took an unlikely chain of events to get Braden Smith to Purdue, but he hasn't looked back since arriving.

title: U.S.'s Cardoso feels 'valued' by Tottenham links
content: Transfer speculation to the Premier League is giving Real Betis midfielder Johnny Cardoso confidence, according to the United States international.

title: Sources: Griezmann to delay Atleti exit for MLS
content: Antoine Griezmann is likely to stay at Atlético Madrid next season, sources have told ESPN, despite his longstanding interest in playing in MLS.

title: Canada could face legal action in Davies injury row
content: Bayern Munich are considering legal action against the Canadian soccer federation following Alphonso Davies' serious knee injury.

title: Chelsea captain Bright warns Barça : 'Bring it on'
content: Chelsea captain Millie Bright has hailed her side's 'unbelievable mentality' and embraced the challenge of facing Barcelona in the UWCL semifinals.

title: Barça vent anger over schedule as Olmo injured
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said his team paid a "high price" for beating Osasuna 3-0 after losing Dani Olmo to injury in a game they were forced to play on Thursday.

title: UEFA to investigate Mbappé, Vini over Atleti game
content: Four Real Madrid players, including Kylian Mbappé and Vinícius Júnior, are being investigated for alleged "indecent conduct" during the Champions League game at Atlético Madrid, UEFA said on Thursday.

title: Source: PSG owners finalizing Málaga purchase
content: Qatar Sport Investment (QSI), the owner of Paris Saint-Germain, are finalising the purchase of the Spanish club Malaga, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Barca, Madrid ... or Atletico -- who wins LaLiga?
content: LaLiga returns with Atleti, Barça and Madrid all after the title. ESPN's Alex Kirkland, Sam Marsden, Sid Lowe, Graham Hunter answer the key questions.

title: Breaking down the Premier League run-in, UCL race
content: A season that has defied expectations looks set for a thrilling contest for Champions League qualification.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United and 'half of Europe' chasing goalkeeper Joan García
content: Espanyol keeper Joan García is wanted by many of Europe's biggest clubs including Man United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Mikaela Mayer's jab, movement vs. Sandy Ryan's power
content: A boxing insider and a former opponent share their predictions for the Mikaela Mayer vs. Sandy Ryan rematch.

title: What the numbers tell us about Mayer vs. Ryan and Zepeda vs. Farmer
content: Two rematches on Saturday, one in Las Vegas, one in Mexico -- here's a look at the fights through the numbers.

title: 2025 preview: Skip Holtz looks to keep Birmingham on top, Bob Stoops takes aim
content: The UFL season kicks off Friday night, with every team looking to mount a challenge to Birmingham's dominance.

title: Why Myanmar is one of the most earthquake-vulnerable countries
content: Myanmar, situated on one of the world’s most active seismic belts, has been severely impacted by a 7.7 magnitude earthquake and a 6.4 aftershock. The country's tectonic setting, combined with rapid urbanisation and historical seismic events, highlights the need for urgent disaster preparedness and improved infrastructure resilience.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's new GPT-4o update has sparked a trend of Studio Ghibli-style portraits, exclusive to select ChatGPT subscription tiers. Despite the delay in the free-tier rollout, users can create similar artworks using free alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI, Craiyon, Artbreeder, and various premium platforms offering free trials.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina share heartwarming moment at Chepauk
content: Ahead of the IPL 2025 clash between CSK and RCB, a heartwarming moment was captured when Virat Kohli and Suresh Raina shared an embrace during RCB's practice session. CSK opted to bowl first with a slight change in their lineup, while RCB captain Rajat Patidar expressed confidence in setting a competitive total.

title: Shinde joke row: Kamra gets protection from arrest till April 7
content: The Madras high court granted interim anticipatory bail to stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra after his video mocking Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde caused outrage. The video, featuring political satire and criticisms of various leaders, led to threats and an FIR against Kamra.

title: 'Boosting Bihar's progress': PM Modi on Rs 3,712 cr Patna-Sasaram corridor
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the Union Cabinet's approval for the Patna-Sasaram corridor project to ease traffic and promote economic growth in Bihar. The Rs 3,712.40 crore project will develop a 120.10 km four-lane corridor, integrating key highways and improving access to major transportation hubs.

title: Intel’s ex-CEO on his ‘forced’ resignation, 'I wasn’t done with ... '
content: Intel's board ended Pat Gelsinger's transformation plan after three years, citing strategic missteps that caused significant revenue loss and market decline. New CEO Lip-Bu Tan aims to streamline operations, boost AI chip production, and revitalize Intel Foundry to regain competitive positioning in the semiconductor industry.

title: Watch: Fans engage in physical fight during RR vs KKR IPL match
content: A viral video shows fans fighting during an IPL 2025 match between Rajasthan Royals and Kolkata Knight Riders at Barsapara Stadium. Security intervened promptly, and additional drama unfolded as a fan ran onto the pitch. Rajasthan Royals suffered a defeat despite home support, with KKR winning by eight wickets led by Quinton de Kock's unbeaten 97.

title: White House joins Studio Ghibli AI trend with a 'warning photo'
content: Studio Ghibli-style AI images of Virginia Basora-Gonzalez, a convicted drug dealer, are unexpectedly posted by the White House on social media. Basora-Gonzalez, who was previously deported and convicted of fentanyl trafficking, has been arrested again for illegally reentering the US.

title: Cabinet approves 2% DA hike for central govt employees
content: The Union Cabinet, led by PM Narendra Modi, approved a 2% increase in Dearness Allowance and Dearness Relief for Central Government employees and pensioners, effective January 1, 2025. The rate rise from 53% to 55% aims to combat inflation, impacting over 115 lakh individuals, with costs estimated at Rs 6,614.04 crore annually.

title: Allahabad HC CJ asked not to assign judicial work to Justice Varma for now: SC
content: The Supreme Court directed the Allahabad High Court to suspend judicial duties for Justice Yashwant Varma amid an inquiry into cash found at his Delhi residence. Amid protests, the government also notified the transfers of Justices Chandra Dhari Singh and Arindam Sinha to the Allahabad High Court.

title: India's fastest man! Gurindervir Singh breaks 100m national record
content: Gurindervir Singh set a new men's 100m national record with 10.20 seconds at the Indian Grand Prix 1, surpassing Manikanta Hoblidhar's previous record. Hoblidhar finished second with 10.22 seconds, followed by Amlan Borgohain in third with 10.43 seconds. Singh's performance highlights a strong competition and Reliance's dominance on the podium.

title: Myanmar earthquake: Videos capture collapsing buildings, cracked roads, and mass panic
content: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar, causing extensive damage and panic in Thailand and China. The tremor, followed by a significant aftershock, destroyed buildings, collapsed a bridge, and damaged infrastructure. Rescue operations are underway as people fled to safety, and emergency teams assess the situation amid warnings of possible aftershocks and further collapses.

title: Empuraan fails to surpass Vicky Kaushal’s Chhaava’s day 1: Top 5 news
content: Top entertainment stories today include Empuraan's box office performance compared to Vicky Kaushal’s Chhaava, Sushmita Sen and Akshay Kumar's hug, Kunal Kamra controversy, Athiya Shetty's baby's welcome ceremony, and the media scrutiny of Rhea Chakraborty. These stories highlight the industry's current events, public reactions, and the ongoing projects and controversies within the celebrity world.

title: 'Nothing new with Eden Gardens curator not listening to home captain'
content: Ex-Bengal cricketer Shreevats Goswami claimed Eden Gardens curator consistently ignores home team requests. The current curator refuted accusations, emphasising adherence to BCCI guidelines and maintaining good relations with KKR. Simon Doull called for prioritising home team needs. KKR captain Rahane desired spin-friendly pitches, but Mukherjee defended his pitch preparations and questioned KKR’s spinners’ performance.

title: 'Ghibli' or 'Jibli'? The correct way to pronounce it
content: The confusion stems from the studio's origin story and the linguistic journey the word "Ghibli" has taken. Initially, "Ghibli" (ギブリ) comes from an Italian word pronounced with a hard "G" (as in "gift"). This Italian word means a hot wind from the Sahara Desert, symbolic of the studio's intent to introduce fresh, new winds into the animation industry. Miyazaki, who has a profound fascination with aviation, specifically named the studio after the Italian Caproni Ca.309 Ghibli aircraft. This historical aircraft also carried the Italian pronunciation, solidifying the hard "G" sound.

title: Vaughan pokes fun at IPL: 'A strategic time-out with 2 needed'
content: Former England captain Michael Vaughan humorously criticised the IPL for a seemingly unnecessary strategic timeout during a match where Lucknow Super Giants needed just two runs off 24 balls. The decision raised eyebrows and was a moment of amusement amidst LSG's comfortable victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad.

title: 'Islamophobic': Activists furious with Pete Hegseth's kafir tattoo
content: US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth is facing intense scrutiny after recent images of an Arabic tattoo reading "kafir," or "infidel," sparked allegations of Islamophobia and anti-Muslim bias from activists and advocacy groups.

title: Cash-at-home row: Centre confirms transfer of Justice Yashwant Varma to Allahabad HC
content: The government has transferred Justice Yashwant Varma from Delhi High Court to Allahabad High Court amid allegations of cash discovery at his residence following a fire. Justice Varma denied the claims, and a Supreme Court in-house committee is investigating the matter. A PIL for an FIR was dismissed, as the inquiry is still ongoing.

title: Indian embassy issues emergency helpline for nationals in Thailand after 7.7 quake
content: The Embassy of India in Bangkok has issued an emergency helpline for Indian nationals in Thailand following a powerful earthquake in Myanmar that impacted the region. The embassy is coordinating with Thai authorities and no incidents involving Indian citizens have been reported yet. Prime Minister Modi expressed readiness to assist affected nations.

title: Last time RCB beat CSK at Chepauk, world cricket looked like this
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) aim to break a 17-year winless streak against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at MA Chidambaram Stadium on Friday. With CSK's spin-friendly conditions and a strong bowling lineup, RCB’s batting, led by Virat Kohli, faces a tough challenge. This crucial match tests RCB's determination to overcome history and the Chepauk curse.

title: Navratri Colours: Nine colours with 2025 date and their significance
content: Each day of Chaitra Navratri is associated with a specific colour, which holds significant meaning and symbolism for the nine forms of Goddess Durga.

title: 'Mass casualty' earthquake rattles Myanmar: What we know so far
content: A massive 7.7 magnitude earthquake hit Myanmar and Thailand, causing significant damage and panic. In Bangkok, under construction building collapsed, trapping 43 workers. In Myanmar, a major hospital has been converted into a mass casualty area. Both countries are experiencing widespread damage and disruption.

title: 'Even Indira Gandhi couldn't do it': What Jaishankar said on Pak mindset
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar informed the Lok Sabha that India is closely monitoring minority attacks in Pakistan and Bangladesh. He highlighted recent incidents targeting Hindus, Sikhs, Ahmadis, and Christians. Jaishankar stressed India's inability to change Pakistan's mindset but affirmed proactive measures to address the issue. The Human Rights Focus Pakistan report noted a rise in minority attacks in 2025.

title: Lewis Hamilton’s brother Nicolas announces surprise return to racing
content: Lewis Hamilton's brother Nicolas returns to the British Touring Car Championship after a 20-month break. His comeback is highlighted by the support of Un-Limited Motorsport, where he aims to promote inclusivity in motorsports for disabled individuals. Despite challenges, Nicolas is prepared to race again, driving a Cupra Leon alongside teammates Dexter Patterson and Max Hall.

title: Karti P Chidambaram meets PM Modi to raise alarm over stray dog crisis
content: Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram met with PM Narendra Modi to address the rising concerns over India's stray dog population and rabies-related deaths. He urged for the creation of a National Task Force and highlighted the need for improved resources and technology to manage the situation more effectively.

title: ‘Yeshu Yeshu’ Pastor Bajinder Singh convicted in 2018 sexual harassment case
content: Bajinder Singh, a self-proclaimed Christian pastor, was convicted by a Mohali court for sexual harassment charges from 2018. The verdict followed his non-bailable warrant and arrest in 2018. Singh faced similar accusations in a separate case. A recent video showing him slapping individuals is being investigated by authorities. Singh has faced multiple legal issues previously.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: Date, time in India and its significance
content: In 2025, India will experience two solar eclipses, one in March and another in September. The first event will be a partial eclipse, while the second will showcase a mesmerizing 'Ring of Fire'. Scientists and space enthusiasts prepare for these cosmic occurrences, while many in India continue to follow traditional rituals and customs during eclipses.

title: Watch: Sports presenter smashes TV in rage over Pant's IPL performance
content: During a live broadcast, a presenter on an Indian sports YouTube channel lost his temper over Lucknow Super Giants skipper Rishabh Pant's IPL 2025 performance, damaging studio equipment. Pant's form in the opening matches, including a six-ball duck and a run-a-ball 15, has left fans and analysts frustrated despite LSG's recent win.

title: 'India stands ready to offer assistance': PM Modi on Myanmar, Thailand quake
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed deep concern over the devastating earthquakes in Myanmar and Thailand, which caused significant destruction, including the collapse of a high-rise building in Bangkok. He assured that India is prepared to provide all possible assistance and has directed authorities to remain on standby. Emergency response efforts are underway in both countries.

title: 'I've never differentiated between Yuvraj & Dhoni': Yograj Singh
content: Former cricketer Yograj Singh, known for his outspoken views, asserted on a podcast that he never differentiates between his son Yuvraj and players like MS Dhoni. He defended struggling stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, suggesting he could reinvigorate the Indian team if made its coach. Previously, he had criticized Dhoni for ending Yuvraj's career prematurely.

title: Watch: Bangkok under construction building crumbles after strong earthquake
content: A powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar on Friday, affecting areas like Bangkok and China's Yunnan province. There were no immediate reports of damage or casualties. An under-construction structure collapsed, causing debris clouds. Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra cut short her visit to Phuket due to the situation.

title: Restaurants can't force customers to pay service charge: Delhi HC
content: The Delhi high court declared that service charges on food bills remain discretionary, dismissing restaurant associations' petitions against Central Consumer Protection Authority's rules. The CCPA guidelines ensure hotels and restaurants cannot automatically add or compel the payment of service charges, emphasizing consumer choice and transparency.

title: Thief flew to Kolkata for rasgullas, Goa for scotch, caught in Gujarat
content: Vikas Namdev, a 26-year-old from Madhya Pradesh, funded his lavish lifestyle through theft. He was apprehended by Vadodara police for stealing gold ornaments worth Rs 34 lakh from female passengers on trains between Vadodara and Surat. Namdev posed as a textile businessman to avoid suspicion.

title: 7.7-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Myanmar, Strong Tremors In Bangkok, 23 Dead
content: Two large earthquakes - 7.7 and 6.4 magnitude - struck central Myanmar Friday morning, causing tremors as far away as northern Thailand, with reports also coming in of tremors in China.

title: Myanmar Earthquake Live: Many Feared Dead In Varsity Fire, Say Reports
content: Myanmar, Thailand Earthquake Live Updates: A powerful earthquake rattled Myanmar and neighbouring Thailand, trapping dozens of workers in a collapsed under-construction skyscraper in Bangkok where a state of emergency was declared.

title: Indian Man Was At Daughter's Bangkok School. Then Massive Earthquake Hit
content: Thailand Earthquake: When the ground began to tremble violently beneath his feet, Prem Kishore Mohanty from India was sitting in the auditorium of his daughter's school in Thailand's Bangkok.

title: Actor Vijay's 'Powerful Storm Coming' Warning Before Tamil Nadu Election
content: Actor Vijay - whose fledgling Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam is considered a dark horse in next year's Assembly election - launched an all-out attack on Tamil Nadu's ruling DMK and Prime Minister Narendra Modi's BJP.

title: "Even Indira Gandhi Couldn't...": S Jaishankar On Pak's "Fanatical Mindset"
content: S Jaishankar today appraised Parliament about the rising incidents of attacks on minorities in Pakistan and Bangladesh. The minister cited ten major incidents involving brutal attacks on Hindus in Pakistan in February alone.

title: Mohanlal's 'Empuraan' Sparks Fresh Congress-BJP Row In Poll-Bound Kerala
content: Kerala's ruling Left front and the main opposition, the Congress, have united to celebrate actor Mohanlal's new movie, 'L2: Empuraan', which they say "exposes the Sangh agenda".

title: Kunal Kamra Jokes On Why Narayana Murthy Likes Working 70 Hours A Week
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra humorously criticises Sudha Murthy's "simple" lifestyle and explains why Narayana Murthy prefers to work 70 hours a week.

title: Centre Clears Rs 62,000-Crore Deal To Buy Made-In-India Attack Helicopter
content: The Cabinet Committee on Security on Friday gave its nod for the biggest ever deal to buy 156 Light Combat Helicopters (LCH) worth over Rs 62,000 crore for the Indian Army and Air Force from Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL).

title: IPL Live: Dhoni's Lightning-Fast Stumping Sends Salt Packing, RCB 1 Down
content: Chennai Super Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: MS Dhoni effected a terrific stumping to dismiss Phil Salt.

title: Video: Girls' Hostel On Fire, 2 Students Climb Down From Balcony, 1 Slips
content: Two students had a narrow escape with the help of locals after a fire broke out at a girls' hostel in Greater Noida today. A video of the incident has gone viral.

title: PM Modi Takes Part In Studio Ghibli Trend, Posts Pics With Trump, Macron
content: The Union government on Friday released a series of Studio Ghibli-style portraits of Narendra Modi, as the Prime Minister joined the viral trend of generating animated versions of images using Artificial Intelligence.

title: Bengaluru Techie Kills Wife, Stuffs Body in Suitcase, Then Attempts Suicide
content: A 36-year-old tech professional in Bengaluru allegedly murdered his wife and stuffed it into a suitcase before fleeing to Pune, where he later attempted suicide.

content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra, at the centre of a massive controversy over his parody of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, is viral again on social media; this time for his bit on industrialist Anand Mahindra.

content: US President Donald Trump shared a CNN clip praising his rising approval ratings, despite years of criticizing the network for "fake news."

content: MS Dhoni is no less than a god-like figure for CSK fans, but this "weird" obsession can sometimes go out of hands.

title: "If You Are Under 40, Leave UK": Woman's Video On Wealth Outflow Goes Viral
content: A video by influencer 'Prudishfish' advising young people to leave the UK due to wealth outflow and rising living costs has gone viral.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Moreno's path to victory over Erceg at UFC Fight Night
content: Brandon Moreno makes his first Octagon appearance of 2025 . the former two-time men's flyweight champion takes on Steve Erceg . moreno, no. 3 in the divisional rankings, lost the title to Alexandre Pantoja in July 2023 .

content: players clubs are most itching to sign from the transferRoom meeting in Berlin . there are owners, general managers, sporting directors and scouts, agents and data analysts . players clubs and representatives of more than 80 agencies are gathered to talk transfers .

content: Bhuvanesh Patil has directed officials to ensure that all works of multi village drinking water project are completed by that time

content: Senior civil judge and DLSA Member-Secretary Parashuram Doddmani calls for scientific agricultural practices for maintaining soil fertility

content: Officials cite the ‘comfortable’ storage position in the Mettur dam; the average yield from various sources continues has been hovering around 160 MLD since March 1

content: Himanta Biswa Sarma says the northeastern States can settle their territorial disputes under the Centre’s supervision

content: Kerala government celebrates its fourth anniversary with ₹50 crore tourism projects, including an oceanarium and marinas, to shape future development.

title: Fitness is no longer just a physical appearance
content: There has been a two-to-threefold increase in fitness centres in Kerala in the post-pandemic period, with people becoming more aware of their health requirements and starting to prioritise their fitness

title: New Vallakadavu bridge linking city to its densely populated coastal regions to be a reality soon
content: The old bridge, spanning the TS Canal, was closed to traffic in 2022 after it was declared to be structurally weak. Currently, motorists use a temporary bridge built a few metres north of the old structure

title: LS Zero Hour: BJP MPs slam insults against Rana Sanga; TMC’s Mahua Moitra says digital data law undermines RTI
content: Nation will not tolerate insults to 16th century Rajput warrior who is part of Indian heritage, says Ravi Shankar Prasad; TMC MP says digital data law can be used to suppress data on wilful defaulters, fine data seekers

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to simplify maritime regulations
content: Sarbananda Sonowal said that the new legislation is part of the government’s broader initiative to eliminate colonial laws and simplify maritime regulations for the ease of doing business

title: Farmers stage protest demanding legal guarantee for minimum support price
content: The Centre had not kept its promise of providing profitable prices for agricultural produce, including paddy and sugarcane, says Desiya Thennindhiya Nadhigal Inaippu Vivasayigal Sangam

title: Minister directs officials to speed up grounding of works on Indiramma houses
content: Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy wants speedy payment of Rs. 1 lakh to houses completed upto basement level

title: Auto Nagar workers find little hope in State government’s plans for upskilling the workforce
content: The State government wants to support the workforce institutionally, by providing them with the required skillset that meets the global standards and prepares them for the competitive world, says NTR District Collector

title: Congress’ Karti Chidambaram meets PM, flags safety concerns posed by stray dogs
content: During the meeting, Mr. Chidambaram suggested establishing a National Task Force to provide a holistic, humane and scientific solution while working closely with local bodies

title: Tiruchi Corporation to take steps to mop up dues from tax defaulters and boost non-tax revenue
content: The civic body expects ₹100 crore in revenue from upcoming integrated bus terminal (IBT), truck terminal, multiutility facility centre, and vegetable market at Panjapur

title: Pune Porsche crash: Two police officers likely to face the axe for shoddy probe
content: Inspector Rahul Jagdale and assistant police inspector Vishwanath Todkari, attached to Yerawada police station, were suspended for late reporting of the incident and dereliction of duty at the time

title: Nod for earned leave surrender with lock-in period
content: Earned leave of government employees and teachers for the 2025-26 fiscal will be credited in their provident fund with effect from April 1

title: Agriculture college students from Keezhvelur visit Parliament, witness Lok Sabha proceedings
content: The group of 20 students from the Agricultural College and Research Institute, Keezhvelur, had won the youth parliament competition held under the ‘Beti Bachao Beti Padhao’ initiative

title: Telangana govt releases ₹3.3 crore ex gratia to 66 Gulf-victim families
content: Each family member was given ₹5 lakh and 66 families got the benefit from the government, said former MLA and State Mineral Development Corporation Chairman Anil Eeravatri

title: Palnadu District Collector interacts with complainants at field level to assess official response
content: The Praja Samasya Pariskara Vedika aims to improve direct interactions with complainants and strengthen the effectiveness of grievance resolution, District Collector said

title: No plans to amend Wildlife Act to give teeth to States in managing human-animal conflicts: Centre
content: In Rajya Sabha, Union Minister urged the State government to use the provisions under Section 11 of the Wild Life (Protection) Act, 1972 to deal with wild animal attacks.  Kerala had requested the Centre to declare wild pigs as “vermin” under Section 62 of the Act.

title: Kerala producers’ body deploys ethical hackers to track down film pirates
content: Efforts on to identify those behind suspected leak of an online version of L2: Empuraan, a few hours after its release on March 27

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Twenty heads of cattle rescued at Bajpe in Mangaluru
content: While the Bajrang Dal activists, who chased the vehicle, alleged that the accused fired at them, the police said there was no visible proof of firing at the spot. Two of the cattle were found dead.

title: State Board class 10 public exams begin in Tamil Nadu
content: Greeting students in a post on X social media platform, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin urged them to write exams without fear or anxiety.

title: Thanjavur Corporation Budget meeting ends abruptly as miffed Mayor leaves the hall
content: A few DMK councillors accused Mayor S. Ramanathan of colluding with the Corporation Commissioner and allowing a convention hall to be converted into a cinema

title: 51 mandals in Andhra Pradesh identified as drought-affected, awaiting government declaration: RP Sisodia
content: The assessment process has been carried out strictly as per the Drought Management Manual, ensuring a structured and data-driven approach, says Special Chief Secretary Revenue

title: INCOIS detects quake in Myanmar, no tsunami threat
content: INCOIS in Hyderabad detects 7.8 magnitude earthquake in Myanmar, no tsunami threat due to land-based location

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman walks out of Business Advisory Committee meet
content: According to an opposition leader, the Chairman walked out due to disagreements between ruling and opposition members over the demand for a discussion on "duplicate" voter id (EPIC) numbers

title: Karnataka State Education Policy Commission fails to meet final report submission deadline
content: Sources said that the submission of the report may be delayed by a couple of months and it is doubtful that SEP will be implemented in the state from the academic year of 2025-26.

title: Cabinet announces ₹6,282 crore Kosi Mechi intra-state river link in Bihar
content: At the Cabinet briefing, Ashwini Vaishnaw also announced the approval of the four lane Patna-Arrah-Sasaram highway corridor project

title: Kunal Kamra gets interim anticipatory bail from Madras High Court
content: Justice Sunder Mohan orders notice, returnable by April 7, to Khar police in Mumbai on the comedian’s main plea for inter State anticipatory bail and grants interim advance bail till then

title: Free cardiac surgery services for children at Hyderabad’s NIMS
content: Children from other States can also avail of the service if they have an Aadhaar card issued in Telangana or Andhra Pradesh

title: Cash discovery row: Justice Varma transferred to Allahabad High Court
content: The Supreme Court has asked the Chief Justice of Allahabad High Court, for the time being, not to assign any judicial work to Justice Yashwant Varma, when he assumes charge as a Judge of the Allahabad High Court.

title: Union Cabinet announces ₹22,919 crore electronics component manufacturing scheme
content: Capacitors, inductors, resistors and connectors will be manufactured in the country, said Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Drug bust at Payyannur in Kerala’s Kannur; three arrested with 166.68 grams of MDMA
content: Acting on a tip-off, police raid a lodge room where an accused was staying. A total of 108.5 grams of MDMA was recovered from his bag in the cupboard, while the rest was found in the pockets of the other two accused

title: Bangladesh welcomes China to participate in Teesta project; ‘Taiwan inalienable part of China,’ Yunus gives ‘firm commitment’
content: “The two sides agreed to promote high-quality Belt and Road cooperation, strengthen international cooperation on industrial and supply chains and work together to achieve modernization in both countries,” the Joint Statement announced

title: Kerala HC dismisses pleas seeking probe against CM, daughter on CMRL-Exalogic transactions
content: HC had earlier issued notice to Pinarayi Vijayan, his daughter on a petition filed by Congress MLA Mathew Kuzhalnadan challenging the order of special court of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau that dismissed the MLA’s plea for probe into the transactions

title: Nepalese woman's death in KIIT: NHRC seeks action taken report from Odisha Government, UGC, NAAC
content: “During the visit, the NHRC team found that the deceased woman had lodged a complaint with KIIT’s International Relations Office, months before taking the extreme step,” the Commission said

title: Restaurants cannot enforce service charge, violates consumer rights: Delhi HC
content: The guidelines issued by CCPA, stated that hotels or restaurant cannot add service charge automatically or by default in the food bill

title: APMRC to execute Vijayawada, Vizag metro railway projects in EPC mode by engaging general consultants
content: The Board also decided not to appoint an executing agency in view of the high cost and certain other disadvantages, APMRC Managing Director said

title: Social justice, women empowerment at the centre of T.N.’s inclusive development, says CM Stalin
content: He was addressing the Confederation of Indian Industries (CII) South India Annual Convention 2025, organised with the theme, ‘Infra South: Crafting Livable Environment in India Cities’

title: Vazhndhu Kattuvom 3.0 will be implemented in 120 blocks with World Bank assistance: Udhayanidhi
content: Mr. Udhayanidhi said the State government will implement a skill development programme to train 42,000 youth to get jobs and become entrepreneurs, at a cost of ₹66 crore

title: Gang of three hailing from Guntur arrested in ‘digital arrest’ scam
content: The accused had links to similar fraud cases across India, including incidents in Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Chhattisgarh

title: Prices of essentials have hit the roof since Congress govt. came to power, says BJP
